name: Mitigation Playbook for PowerShell Backdoor Incident
description: This playbook addresses an incident where an attacker gained administrative access through a compromised email, executing PowerShell scripts to establish a backdoor.

action--b123dd4e-efc4-4f13-9b8b-527b981a.name: Kill malicious PowerShell process
action--b123dd4e-efc4-4f13-9b8b-527b981a.description: Terminate any lingering malicious PowerShell scripts.

commands.command: while pgrep -f 'powershell'; do pkill -f 'powershell'; sleep 5; done

action--15f7aebe-f829-44c8-9490-3c1d7345.name: Block network connection to C2 server
action--15f7aebe-f829-44c8-9490-3c1d7345.description: Prevent any outbound communication to the attacker’s command and control server.

action--cf4fe212-bc9d-471c-af6c-3357c82d.name: Remove unauthorized administrative account
action--cf4fe212-bc9d-471c-af6c-3357c82d.description: Delete the unauthorized account created by the attacker.

action--95316459-c98f-4b3d-9b6c-2dae4b75.name: Scan for additional malicious scripts
action--95316459-c98f-4b3d-9b6c-2dae4b75.description: Run a scan to identify any additional threats on the system.

action--remove-infected-files.name: Remove infected files
action--remove-infected-files.description: Delete all files that were flagged by the last scan.

action--bb1032a7-7012-4e3c-b469-6fc3f855.name: Strengthen email filtering rules
action--bb1032a7-7012-4e3c-b469-6fc3f855.description: Update the email filtering to block suspicious attachments.
